decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the powerful UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate large amounts of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine, while also using versatile planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon for control. The deck also includes cards like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and efficient mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with creatures using cards like Faithless Looting, Stitcher's Supplier, and Insolent Neonate, in order to trigger abilities that bring creatures back from the graveyard without needing to cast them from your hand. This allows you to quickly overwhelm your opponent with a steady stream of creatures like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine, while also potentially ramping into bigger threats like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The deck focuses on maximizing graveyard synergies to constantly pressure your opponent and win through powerful combo plays.

The focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures using cards like Faithless Looting, Satyr Wayfinder, and Stitcher's Supplier, then bring them back to the battlefield with cards like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine. The key strategy is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to keep cycling through your graveyard and play powerful creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. Combining this with sacrifice outlets like Carrion Feeder and removal spells like Lightning Axe and Assassin's Trophy, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive graveyard-based combo.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells and then bringing back Arclight Phoenix to deal heavy damage to the opponent. It includes a mix of cheap spells like Gut Shot and Lightning Bolt to trigger the Phoenix's ability, as well as card draw and selection spells to keep the momentum going. Aria of Flame can also be used to close out the game if necessary. The strategy is to be aggressive and overwhelming, utilizing the Phoenix's powerful recursive ability to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cards like Faithless Looting to fill your graveyard with creatures such as Gravecrawler, Vengevine, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. By using cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Satyr Wayfinder to mill yourself, you can easily bring back creatures from your graveyard and overwhelm your opponent with a strong board presence. The inclusion of Leyline of the Void helps to disrupt opposing graveyard strategies, while cards like Cryptbreaker and Carrion Feeder provide additional utility and ways to generate advantage. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board state.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Stitcher's Supplier, Satyr Wayfinder, and Faithless Looting to enable graveyard recursion with creatures like Gravecrawler and Bloodghast. This allows for explosive plays with Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine, overwhelming the opponent and building a formidable board presence. Utilizing cards like Fatal Push and Carrion Feeder for removal and sacrifice effects adds another layer of synergy to the deck, making it a powerful and versatile combo archetype in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on using Urza, Lord High Artificer and Thopter Foundry to generate a lot of tokens and create a defensive board state. It uses artifacts like Chromatic Star and Mishra's Bauble to generate more mana and card advantage, while also utilizing cards like Galvanic Blast for removal. The deck can tutor for key pieces with cards like Whir of Invention and uses Goblin Engineer to recur important artifacts. It also has some control elements with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Grafdigger's Cage to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron land package (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a massive amount of colorless mana quickly. This mana is then used to cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, while controlling the board with cards like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus. The deck aims to ramp up quickly, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and overwhelm them with big threats and powerful abilities.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play low-cost spells to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard. This is achieved through cards like Gut Shot, Lava Dart, Lightning Bolt, and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck also includes card draw and mana fixing with Faithless Looting, Wrenn and Six, and Manamorphose. By consistently casting spells and filling the graveyard, players can bring back multiple Arclight Phoenixes for a fast and powerful offensive strategy in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of creatures and spells to create a toolbox of abilities and options. The deck focuses on creatures with abilities that can be summoned using Chord of Calling and Collected Company. These creatures include Devoted Druid, Kitchen Finks, Eternal Witness, and Scavenging Ooze, among others. The deck also includes mana-generating creatures like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch, as well as support cards like Giver of Runes and Ranger-Captain of Eos. The deck aims to take advantage of its toolbox of creatures to create powerful and versatile plays.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine, and then use cards like Carrion Feeder and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis to combo off and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. Cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Satyr Wayfinder help facilitate this strategy by milling cards into the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive graveyard-based strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. By using cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's strategy and accelerate the deployment of powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and consistently. The inclusion of utility lands like Blast Zone and Ghost Quarter provides additional disruption options, while cards like Walking Ballista and Dismember offer removal and flexibility in dealing with opposing threats.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Human creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, it aims to quickly buff its creatures and deal massive damage. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage helps control the opponent's board and keep the pressure on. The use of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while the mana base of Ancient Ziggurat, Cavern of Souls, and Horizon Canopy ensures smooth mana production for casting spells.

This Modern deck focuses on quickly casting spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability and deal damage to the opponent. By using efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, along with card draw and graveyard recursion, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and consistent aggression. Additionally, cards like Thing in the Ice and Aria of Flame provide additional threats and win conditions. The deck's mana base is designed to support the low casting cost of the spells, allowing for smooth gameplay and powerful turns.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing artifacts to help lock down the opponent's board while generating incremental advantage through card draw. It relies on cards like Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek to create a repeatable source of tokens and life gain, while also using Urza, Lord High Artificer to generate mana and provide a powerful win condition. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Ensnaring Bridge and Grafdigger's Cage to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the key concept revolves around resource management and controlling the pace of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana to cast powerful spells like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift, allowing the player to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and deal massive amounts of damage to their opponent. The deck focuses on utilizing Valakut triggers and landfall effects to overwhelm the opponent with a combo that can win the game in just a few turns. The deck also includes removal spells like Anger of the Gods to control the board and protect the combo until it can be assembled.
